CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 26, 1953, pg. 34 reads: "McClendons Can Now Park, Display $4,100 1953 Trailer Home - Following an article in Courier last week asking where Mr. and Mrs. Charles L. McClendon and their son, Percy, 17, hospital workers from Las Vegas, Nev., could park their brand new $4,100 1953 Brentwood Trailer Home, dozens of calls were made to the Courier and Pittsburgh Hospital by folks who wanted the McClendons to rent their lots. By Monday, the McClendons were able to take their trailer out of storage and park it on a lot near East Lemington Avenue and Chadwick Street, Penn Township.  In the far right picture, Mrs. McClendon is shown in the kitchen of her trailer.  Through the door at the rear of the room, the full length bed which helps to make up the main bedroom, can be seen.-Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Mrs. Charles McClendon standing in kitchen of trailer home, near East Lemington Avenue and Chadwick Street, Penn Twp.
